snippet: A nationalist furor has swept Bollywood since an army base was attacked last month, threatening to derail the release of films starring Pakistani actors....
abstract: Indian government officials, after meeting with delegation led by Film & Television Producers Guild of India president Mukesh Bhatt, say measures will be taken to ensure film Ae Dil Hai Mushkil, starring Pakistani actor Fawad Khan, will not be disrupted by violence; threats have been made against Pakistani performers in wake of September attack on Army base that India says was perpetrated by Pakistani militants.
lead_paragraph: A nationalist furor has swept Bollywood since an army base was attacked last month, threatening to derail the release of films starring Pakistani actors.

headline.main: India Takes Steps to Counter Threats of Violence Over Movie Release
headline.print_headline: India Takes Steps to Counter Threats of Violence Over Film
